title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News
summary: cobblers fans 'would like to stand at matches ' .
today 's weather : cold and cloudy , wintry showers .

documents.title: ex soldier not guilty of sleep rape
text: ex soldier not guilty of sleep rape

documents.title: bath 32-30 northampton
text: bath 32-30 northampton
author: Gary Smee
BBC Sport

documents.title: that 's it from us
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished for the week .
we 'll be back on monday at 08:00 .
any breaking news will appear here through the evening and weekend .
you can scroll down through the day 's events , but here are some of highlights :

documents.title: northampton hospital cancelled 256 operations , figures show
text: new nhs figures show northampton general hospital cancelled 256 operations in the last quarter of 2016 .
this compared with 282 the previous quarter , 229 in april to june 2016 and 207 between january and april last year .
a spokeswoman for northampton general hospital said : we are very sorry that there are times when we have to cancel appointments at very short notice .
`` unfortunately , we experience periods of extreme pressure when we simply have more patients than available beds .
`` if your appointment has been cancelled , the likelihood is that we 've had to use that bed space to admit an acutely unwell patient . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: weather : rain , sleet or snow expected in places
text: further outbreaks of rain , sleet or snow and this could lead to a covering of snow in places across the bbc east region tonight .
it 's also likely to turn quite murky at times with the risk of frost and ice , as temperatures fall .
minimum temperature : -1c ( 30f ) .
saturday will be cold and cloudy with further wintry showers feeding in on a light-to-moderate north to north-easterly wind .
these showers are likely to turn mainly to rain by the afternoon .
maximum temperature 4c ( 39f ) .
more details from bbc weather :
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: remember this ? shoes being stitched in northampton in 1964
text: fifty three years ago this month , a photographer caught on camera uppers being stitched at a shoe factory in northampton .
for hundreds of years the town was the centre of the british shoe-making industry .

documents.title: injured north may be fit for wales
text: northampton saints ' george north has taken part in light training ahead of wales ' six nations match against england in cardiff tomorrow .
north is recovering from a dead leg and will be given until one hour before kick-off to prove his fitness .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: saints ' brookes on bath game : 'we can match challenges '
text: northampton saints play away tonight against bath in the premiership - a challenge which prop kieran brookes believes they can match .
brookes , 26 , told premiershiprugby.com : `` the atmosphere at the club is very positive .
`` we reviewed the game from last weekend and found a lot of things we think we did well , but some things we can work on and improve heading back into the premiership cycle .
`` bath bring some huge challenges , especially up front , but we are going into the game with a lot of confidence and believe we can match those challenges . ''
he went on to say saints need to show the same kind of attack they showed in the final 20 minutes of that game to get the win tomorrow .

documents.title: m1 roadworks completion delayed until december
text: a £ 94.1m scheme to reduce congestion on the m1 by making it a `` smart motorway '' has been delayed .
as reported in the northampton chronicle and echo , the delay may extend to december .
a statement on the highways england website said : `` we had aspired to complete phase one of the project ( between junctions 16 and 19 ) by this spring .

`` however , challenges to the project , including a delayed start to the work and additional essential maintenance works , have meant the programme has been extended to a revised completion date by the end of december 2017 . ''
the hard shoulder in both directions will be converted to an extra traffic lane as part of the project .
work started on the scheme in november 2015 .

documents.title: it 's snowing ! sort of so here 's your afternoon forecast
text: we knew it was cold , but here was the scene in irchester this morning where a light smattering of snow was snapped by weather watcher deeembee .
and it 's set to stay cold .
this afternoon bbc weather says during the afternoon the showers are likely to become more scattered and lighter , but it 'll feel very cold in brisk winds .
tonight it will be cloudy overnight with occasional snow showers continuing .
winds will strengthen by dawn and a widespread frost will form .
it 'll feel very cold , with a low of 0c ( 32f ) .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: operation to free woman trapped in man 's body
text: david from northampton discovered he was a girl trapped in a boy 's body at an early age .
he kept his secret for 40 years before finally coming out to his family and work colleagues .
last week he had major surgery to finally change him physically into a woman called claire .
he 's been speaking to us about the operation
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'you can get so many benefits from it ' # peoplescup
text: england player alex scott `` would 've loved the opportunity to have a competition like this when i was younger '' .
what 's she talking about ?
the fa people 's cup - the country 's biggest free five-a-side competition which gives you the chance to make your way to wembley .
`` when i was younger , playing in a football cage , the dream was always to play at wembley , '' adds scott .
`` the fa people 's cup gives anyone the opportunity to sign up to a local team in your area .
you do n't have to rely on your mates .
`` it 's a chance to meet different people , socialise in different environments .
it 's more than just signing up , you can get so many benefits from it . ''
so what are you waiting for ?
sign up for the fa people 's cup - but hurry as the deadline for entries is the 19 february !

documents.title: police football liaison officer supports safe standing at home games
text: northamptonshire police 's football liaison officer says having `` safe '' standing areas at home games could be `` brilliant '' .
he said : `` from a policing point of view it saves that argument between a steward , who 's trying to keep people safe by telling people to sit in a seated area .
`` so if there 's an area where people could stand , and support safely , brilliant , let 's do it . ''
he added that as a fan , he 'd like to see it introduced .
his comments follow a survey showing 85 % of cobblers fans would like standing introduced at sixfields , echoing a new area developed at celtic .
the government says it `` remains unconvinced '' by the case to reintroduce safe standing to the top two leagues of english football .
northampton town said it would be inappropriate to comment as it 's just an idea by fans at this stage .

documents.title: what are the benefits of standing at northampton town games ?
text: standing at football matches brings a wealth of positives for supporters , says tom reed from the cobblers safe standing group .
he said : `` the choice of being able to stand up or sit down , it negates quarrels between those that do want to stand and stewards that are trying to get them to sit down .

`` there 's also the atmosphere side of things - a choir does n't sit down to sing , it stands , and you know , people that are like-minded can congregate together in an area , so that 's always a good thing to improve atmosphere .

`` there 's the safety side if you stand up or celebrate a goal in an all-seater stadium , there 's a trip hazard with a seat in front of you , so you can potentially fall down over your seat if someone pushes you by accident .
`` with safe standing , you negate that trip hazard , that 's a good thing .
and then probably the last thing for me is that in winter it gets really cold , so to stand up , you can jig about , not sit down in the seat with the cold going through you ! ''
meanwhile , northampton town football club says it 's only an idea by fans at present and has declined to comment .

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: to sit or to stand , that is the question
text: more now on the concept of safe standing at home games for cobblers fans , who say they 'd like `` the choice '' .
sixfields was built as an `` all-seater '' stadium following legislation passed in the wake of the hillsborough disaster .
but since then systems of `` safe-standing '' , which are widely used in germany , are here in the uk at celtic .
now 85 % of northampton town fans surveyed by the supporters ' trust say they 'd like the option to stand .

james averill , from the trust , said : `` i think there 's a growing demand for it and a wish to see supporters given the choice of whether to sit or stand at a match , and i think having that choice would be a good thing .
`` we 're seeing a growing demand in the premier league for it as well . ''

documents.title: labour wins corby council by-election
text: labour has won a council by-election in corby .
isabel mcnab topped the poll in the kingswood and hazel leys ward with 610 votes - 358 more than conservative stan heggs in second place .
the green party 's michael mahon came in third with 82 votes .
the seat on corby borough council was left vacant when kenneth carratt was disqualified for not attending council meetings .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cobblers fans 'would like to stand at matches '
text: northampton town fans would like the choice of being able to stand at home games , a survey commissioned by the supporters trust has concluded .

the sixfields stadium was built as an all-seater stadium following legislation passed in the wake of the hillsborough disaster , but since then systems of safe-standing have been developed which are used widely in germany and in the uk , at celtic .
tom reed from the cobblers safe-standing group , said : `` the survey we conducted in alliance with the supporters trust speaks for itself .
it came back with an 85 % approval rating for the choice of safe standing .
`` you can see a desire for people to stand , not just hear it if you look at the north stand at cobblers matches , the shoe army are often on their feet . ''
northampton town football club said as it is only an idea at present , it would be inappropriate to comment .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: today 's weather : cold and cloudy , wintry showers
text: many places in the region saw a light dusting of snow yesterday and there 'll be the risk of further wintry showers - not only today , but also into saturday .
it will be cold and cloudy to start with , although we are mostly starting off with temperatures just about freezing .
there could be some sleet around later , but generally the further west you are the drier it will tend to be .
the maximum temperature will be about 3c ( 37f ) , but in reality it will feel colder than that because of the bitterness of the easterly wind .
for more head to bbc weather .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from northamptonshire
text: good morning and welcome back to the live page where we 'll bring you updates of the latest news , weather , travel and sport for the three counties until 18:00 .
this morning we 'll start by looking at how northampton town fans have said they would welcome the chance to stand during matches at sixfields .
but first , as the weather continues cold , we 'll have a full regional weather forecast .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's it from us
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
we 'll be back between tomorrow at 08:00 .
any breaking news will appear here through the evening and over night .
scroll down throught the day 's events , but here are some of highlights :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: a cold night , with the risk of snow flurries
text: this evening will stay cloudy and cold , with the risk of further snow flurries moving in from the north sea .
this could bring a dusting of snow in places by morning , and the risk or a frost and icy patches .
staying above freezing on the coast , but inland temperatures will fall to -2c ( 28f ) .
some parts of the region could wake up to a dusting of snow tomorrow , and the risk of snow showers will continue through the day and overnight .
a bitter north easterly wind will push snow showers further inland during the day .
temperatures reaching a high of 3c ( 37f ) .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: town develops its own lottery idea to fund voluntary groups
text: daventry could get a step closer to having its own community lottery tonight .
politicians at the district council are expected to recommend that an online game is set up to raise money for local charities .
as other sources of public funding are dwindling , charities are turning increasingly to district councils for funding .
and they do n't have much money either , so at least three of northamptonshire 's authorities are looking at setting up a lottery to plug the gap .
in a survey , eight out of ten voluntary groups said they liked the idea and six out of ten residents said they would buy a ticket at least occasionally .
it would be a pound to enter and it 's likely that half of that would go to a participating charity nominated by each entrant .
if the council 's strategy group approve it tonight , the full council will make a final decision .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: six nations : north given until kick off to prove fitness
text: despite being named in the welsh starting xv , there are no guarantees george north will play for his country against england on saturday .
interim head coach rob howley says the northampton wing will be given every opportunity right up until kick off to prove his fitness .
north played on after suffering a bruised thigh in the second minute of wales win over italy last weekend .
head coach rob howley said the 24-year-old had taken a limited part in training during the week .
`` george has n't done too much this week , '' he said .
`` we 'll go to the day of the game .
it 's a big game , [ george north ] wants to be part of that game as you 'd expect . ''
author: Chris Jones
BBC rugby reporter

documents.title: adult social care funding plea
text: the conservative leader of northamptonshire county council has repeated her call for more central government funding for adult social care .

earlier heather smith said she had written to the county 's mps asking them to `` fight for fairer funding for us '' as northamptonshire 's adult social care needs are `` far greater '' than in surrey .
the conservative leader says she 's been assured there was no special deal for surrey after yesteday 's political row .
heather smith also said she was `` not comfortable '' with proposing a 4.98 % rise in council tax for the next financial year , but felt the authority had little choice .
northamptonshire county council 's difficulties in funding are replicated across the country - but the authority is trying to make its case as loudly as it can , she said .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: local paper round-up : northampton clean-up , new school in east northants , and daventry college campus
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: six nations : north selected to face england on saturday
text: northampton saints wing george north has won his fitness battles and is named in wales 's team to face england on saturday .
he has recovered from leg injury sustained in the the 33-7 six nations win over italy in rome , and will face the reigning champions in cardiff .
he 'll be up against his saints team-mates dylan hartley and courtney lawes .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: christmas day baby finally home
text: the baby daughter of poorly mum katherine boulton was discharged from hospital this week , and returned home to market harborough .
author: Harborough Mail

documents.title: weather : cold with a few sleet and snow showers
text: it will stay cold and rather cloudy this afternoon with one or two very light sleet or snow showers .
the odd brighter spell is possible but , with brisk easterly winds , it will feel especially cold with a high of just 2c ( 36f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: foden continues on the wing and harrison returns for bath game
text: northampton saints have announced their team for the premiership game against bath tomorrow .
with fellow saints tom wood and george north with their international squads , ben foden once again captains the side and stays on the wing .
teimana harrison plays in the back row after being released by england .
@ twitterid is back !
your saints are

documents.title: traffic and travel : problems persist on a47
text: we told you earlier about the four-vehicle crash on the a47 in wansford which closed the road in both directions .
we 're now being told that the road has reopened - but traffic is still very slow in the area .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: more shops at leisure park gets approval
text: more shops at leisure park gets approval

documents.title: northamptonshire 's needs 'far greater ' than surrey
text: the leader of northamptonshire county council has said she has contacted the county 's mps to get a similar budget deal to the one given to surrey .

yesterday , the government said surrey had asked to take part in the pilot of a new business rates scheme after they were accused of offering a `` sweatheart '' deal by labour , to stop a referendum over a 15 % rise in council tax to pay for the rising costs of social care .
heather smith , conservative leader of northamptonshire , say the county 's adult social care needs are `` far greater '' than surrey 's
downing street said all conversations between the government and surrey had been `` entirely appropriate '' and there was no `` sweetheart deal '' .
surrey county council has restricted the increase to 4.99 % , so a referendum was no longer needed .
have emailed our mps asking them to fight for fairer funding for us given the deal surrey seems to have struck .
our needs are far greater .
@ twitterid perhaps you could ask @ twitterid what happened to £ 10.2 m of # northampton borough money lost through dodgy loans ?
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northamptonshire mps back brexit bill
text: mps have overwhelmingly agreed to let the government begin the uk 's departure from the eu as they voted for the brexit bill .
the draft legislation was approved by 494 votes to 122 , and now moves to the house of lords .
all of northamptonshire mps , who are all conservative , backed the bill , including south northamptonshire mp , and environment secretary andrea leadsom
so the # article50bill is on its way to the lords , unamended , and with huge majority in hoc .
we are leaving the eu for a brighter future !
why are we congratulating traitors ?
do n't get it !
@ twitterid i am overjoyed .
i am not a european never will be
of course you are .
where do you think you came from .
did you just pop up lol
well philip using that argument i am also related to adam and eve ! !
and with talented people like you running the country mrs # leadsom what could possibly go wrong ?
my brighter future is definitely in the eu # brexit
so nearly , you were nearly there , do not worry you will be such a force .
although not for a couple of years because you tories see it as a re-election tool

we will but unfortunately it will not be until march 2019 when the exit negotiations finish on no deal
if they finish the tories have an arrogance that suggests they are better negotiators than the eu .

documents.title: brexit bill : how our mps voted
text: cambridge 's labour mp , daniel zeichner ( was the only one in the county to come out against the triggering of article 50 in last night 's crucial commons vote .
the bill will pave the way for britain to leave the european union over the course of two years .
cambridgeshire 's other mps , all conservatives , voted for the bill :
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: six nations : wood on the bench for england , but lawes and hartley start
text: northampton saints flanker tom wood is only fit enough for a place on the bench for england 's six nations game against wales in cardiff on saturday .

wood suffered a shoulder injury in grand slam champions england 's opening 19-16 win at home to france on saturday and left twickenham with his arm in a sling , but he is returning to training today .
however , england coach eddie jones said : `` tom wood will also play his part later in the game off the bench as a finisher . ''
england will once again be captained by saints dylan hartley , with team-mate courtney lawes in the second row .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crash closes a47 in both directions at wansford
text: a warning now - to avoid the a47 at wansford if you can - the road is closed both ways as emergency services attend a four-vehicle crash .
it happened at 08:30 .
three cars and a lorry are involved .
the air ambulance is also in the area .
there are also long delays on the a14 between huntingdon and cambridge , after crashes on both carriageways earlier .
we 'll bring you more as we get it .
a6118 wansford - the road has been closed from the a47 roundabout due to an rtc .

documents.title: six nations 2017 : north doubtful for england game
text: northampton saints wing george north will be given time to prove his fitness after suffering an injury during the 33-7 win in italy at the weekend .
north played on after taking an early blow to the thigh in sunday 's six nations win in rome , and scored a try after a 60-metre run in 77th minute .
wales next match is the home tie against england on saturday .
`` we are giving george north as long as possible to make the game , '' welsh defence coach shaun edwards said .
`` there 's really bad bruising on george 's leg and the flight home did n't help .
we are worried . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: rushden lakes : a long-running saga
text: east northamptonshire council first approved plans for rushden lakes in 2012 , but the decision was called in by the then-communities secretary eric pickles .
there was much opposition to the scheme from the likes of northampton borough council saying that it would damage town centres .
mps clashed in the commons about it .
but eventually , in june 2014 , it was given government approval .
but it did n't end there
there were expansion plans approved in september 2015 which increased retail space by 3.6 % .
then last year a cinema and bowling alley were given the go-ahead .
will these latest plans be the last changes ?
we will wait and see between now and its planned opened this summer .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rushden lakes 'ticks all the boxes ' say planners
text: the chair of the planning committee at east northamptonshire council has said `` how could you even want to think about stopping a project like [ rushden lakes ] ?
last night , the councillors unanimously approved expansion plans , which will see an increase in shops and car parking spaces .

phil stern said that the development `` ticks all the boxes '' , saying that it will bring `` economic benefit for the whole area and jobs '' and that it also provided leisure facilities and not just shops .
there was opposition from other local authorities , worried it would damage their town centres .
however mr stern said they had had advice from `` town planners and consultants '' who told them that rushden town centre and wellingborough would be most affected by rushden lakes .
however , to counter that developers have `` put in place a lot of mitigation ideas '' , such as new town centre managers , and `` put in the money , over £ 1m '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rushden lakes expansion plans approved
text: councillors in east northamptonshire have approved plans to expand the rushden lakes shopping and leisure development .
the latest planning application has 36 shops and 18 restaurants , 1,900 car parking spaces , and the cinema would have 14 screens instead of 12 .
that 's an extra eight shops and 500 car park spaces , but the planned hotel and leisure club would not be built .
the developers say rushden lakes , once completed , will create 3,760 jobs .
the plans were backed by all fourteen councillors with none against and no abstentions .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cold and cloudy with scattered sleet and snow showers
text: it will be a cold and rather cloudy day across the bbc east region with well-scattered light sleet or snow showers .
the odd brighter spell is possible though but it will feel bitterly cold with a keen easterly breeze with a high of 3c ( 37f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: hello again .
live updates have resumed for northamptonshire .
this morning we 'll have more on rushden lakes , and news of a new contract at northampton saints .
plus all the rest of the news , sport and travel for the county .
but first up the weather .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's it for today
text: our regular updates of news , travel , sport and weather have finished for today .
we 'll be back at 08:00 when we 'll be following the story of a woman who 's living in a refuge for victims of domestic violence .
we 'll also have the latest on the rushden lakes development .
any breaking stories will appear here overnight .
have a good evening .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : light snow possible tonight and wintry tomorrow
text: this evening will be rather cloudy with outbreaks of light rain or drizzle .
some turning to sleet or snow to give a light dusting in places .
there will be a widespread frost with the risk of icy patches .
lows of -1c ( 30f ) .
tomorrow will be rather cloudy and feeling very cold as an easterly wind establishes itself .
a few light coastal showers pushing further inland as the easterly wind freshens .
any showers will turn increasingly wintry , with snow flurries developing into the evening and overnight .
highs of just 2c ( 36f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: police name man struck on the a45
text: officers have named a 48-year-old pedestrian who died after being hit on the a45 in northampton .
martin bridgman , from little billing , was struck by two vehicles on the westbound carriageway , between great billing way and the riverside junction , on tuesday night .
it was not known why mr bridgman was in the road at 22:40 , police said .
anyone with information or who witnessed what happened has been asked to contact police .

documents.title: severe weather measures introduced in south northamptonshire
text: officials in south northamptonshire have urged anyone who knows a rough sleeper in the area to get in touch as temperatures start to plummet .
the `` severe weather protocol '' has been introduced as temperatures are forecast to drop below zero degrees for three consecutive days .
the protocol says that hotel accommodation will be provided for anyone with nowhere else to go .
other help could also be provided , such as money for food and clothes .
the council says it 'll try to contact anyone who 's vulnerable if people provide information about them by calling 01327 322374 .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: a6 on schedule to reopen by end of february
text: northamptonshire highways says the a6 rothwell and desborough bypass could reopen by the end of the month .
the section of busy road was closed in mid-january after an inspection revealed `` voids '' under the surface .
work on the south side of the carriageway has nearly finished .
the excavation of the north side is now under way .
the area will then be filled to create a new road surface before the route is reopened .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: message of tolerance from mary queen of scots
text: on a windswept hill in east northamptonshire , a wreath was laid to remember one of the tragic figures of british history who was beheaded on the same site exactly 430 years ago .
mary queen of scots had been imprisoned in fotheringhay castle after being accused of planning to assassinate her cousin , queen elizabeth i .
earlier , the congregation at a special service in fotheringhay church was told that her attitude to her executioners had been a `` powerful example of forgiveness '' .
elisabeth manson from the marie stuart society , set up to preserve the memory of the 16th century queen , said she wanted people from different faiths to live peacefully together .
`` she made a declaration that people in scotland should be free to worship in the protestant faith , so long as she could worship privately and personally in her own faith .
i think we can learn from that message today . ''
meanwhile , the last letter written by mary queen of scots has gone on display at the national library in scotland to mark the anniversary of her death .
the priceless and fragile document can only be exhibited for a few hours .
it was written six hours before the execution and asks for prayers for `` a queen who has borne the title most christian , and who dies a catholic , stripped of all her possessions '' .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: mary queen of scots 'powerful example of forgiveness '
text: the vicar of fotheringhay has led tributes to mary queen of scots ( below ) in a service to mark the 430th anniversary of her execution at fotheringhay castle .
the 44-year-old monarch was beheaded on the orders of her cousin , queen elizabeth i , after being found guilty of trying to assassinate her .
rev ann hindle told the congregation at today 's service that `` mary 's tragic death bears similarities with that of jesus christ .
she forgave her executioners .
`` we are in awe of the legacy she gives us - a powerful example of forgiving those who cause us great distress . ''
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: hunt for bloodhounds in corby
text: an appeal has been launched for blood donors in corby .
but volunteers will have to be healthy , of good temperament and be able to wag their tails
we 're such a hoot not even willow here can cope
the pet blood bank charity is organising a donation session for dogs on saturday .
it says there 's big demand for blood for animals that have been injured in accidents or require medical treatment for illnesses .

certain breeds , such as old english sheepdogs and lurchers , will be particularly welcome at this weekend 's event , but any dog between one and eight that has n't travelled abroad and is n't on medication can come along .
the charity 's founder , wendy barnett , says the canine volunteers enjoy the experience of giving blood because they get toys and biscuits , and even a souvenir to take home .
saturday 's session takes place at northlands veterinary hospital on george street in corby .
owners can call to register or visit the charity 's website .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: ex-soldier 'raped woman in his sleep '
text: ex-soldier 'raped woman in his sleep '

documents.title: weather : cold and cloudy so far , could see snow tonight
text: the cold and cloudy conditions across the county are reflected in this view of cottesbrooke by weather watcher jonboy , who recorded a temperature of 3c ( 37f ) .
it 's likely to be brighter and colder this afternoon , climbing no further than 5c ( 41f ) .
there 's a possibility of light snow showers overnight , particularly in the east of the county .
get the latest forecast from the bbc weather site .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'i do n't see why she was beheaded ' - northants children learn about executed queen
text: a service has been taking place in the village where mary queen of scots was executed , to mark the 430th anniversary of her death .
the 44-year-old monarch had been found guilty of trying to assassinate queen elizabeth i and was beheaded at fotheringhay castle on 8 february 1587 .
local schoolchildren took part in today 's remembrance service , which was followed by the laying of a wreath at the castle mound .
youngsters at warmington school have been learning about one of the most tragic figures in british history .
`` we 've been learning that she was elizabeth the first 's cousin and she got put in prison , but she escaped before she got beheaded , '' said will .
fred ca n't understand why she had to be executed : `` i do n't see why she got beheaded .
perhaps it was because she was second in line to the throne and was seen as a threat . ''
you can read more at bbc history .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: funding gap of £ 20m at northampton borough council
text: northampton borough council says it has a funding gap of £ 19.9m over the next five years .
the authority says it means a `` fundamental review of the way in which services are provided '' will be needed .
its budget for the next financial year shows a £ 5 a year council tax rise for band d homes .
borough and district councils run services like rubbish collection and housing , as well as making most planning decisions .
the biggest demands at a local level are adult social care and children 's services - both run by the county council and not borough and districts .
but with central government funding being reduced and councils expected to generate more income themselves , all our local authorities are having to change how they operate .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: 'should we just sit in our shawls and do a bit of knitting ? '
text: a woman from northampton has started a petition for better provision for people who travel by coach from the town centre .
following the demolition of the greyfriars bus station two years ago , coaches have been collecting passengers in victoria street .
dagmar king , who 's 70 , said greyfriars offered somewhere warm and dry to wait with working toilets , but the new facility is just a series of bus shelters with a lavatory that is often broken .
ms king says the state of the coach stop is also making it difficult for older people to go on holidays .
just because we 're past a certain age , are n't we supposed to go on holiday ?
should we just sit in our shawls and do a bit of knitting ? ''
the borough council says better coach facilities will be part of the new development that 's planned for the site of the old bus station .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'is this what i want for my life ? ' - calls for more facilities for rough sleepers in northants
text: jason , who uses the sanctuary night shelter in rushden , says `` if it were n't for this place , i 'd be in the gutter '' .
there are just six beds for rough sleepers in the building ; when they are full , some users have to sleep in a shed on the site .
jason became homeless after getting into debt and says the shelter is not `` hunky dory '' , but it 's a roof over his head .
`` you 've got to think : is this what you want for your life ?
at the end of the day , it 's just a bed , but you can sleep properly and you 're not going to get mugged or beaten up . ''
the shelter is run by the full gospel church .
rev mark lees says it 's the only emergency service for the homeless covering the east of the county and over the border into peterborough .
he believes the county needs between 30 and 50 beds to meet the current demand .
author: Carroll Weston
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: rushden lakes expansion due to be considered by council
text: an expansion of the rushden lakes shopping and leisure development will be considered by east northamptonshire councillors tonight .
according to the latest planning application , the number of shops would increase from 28 to 36 with 1,900 car parking spaces - up from 1,400 .
it 's recommended for approval , despite opposition from a number of other local authorities .

documents.title: homeless 'sleeping in sheds and cars ' in rushden
text: people who find themselves homeless are having to sleep in a shed and in cars on the site of a night shelter in rushden because of a shortage of accommodation .
the sanctuary provides six beds , but those who run it say that 's `` just a fraction '' of what 's required .
people from corby , kettering , wellingborough and northampton are turning up at the shelter because of a lack of provision elsewhere , according to rev mark lees who runs the facility .
`` last night we had two people sleeping in the shed it 's basically the smoking area for the church they are covered from the rain and we hand out a mattress and some bedding , '' he said .
`` it 's common that we 've got extras either sleeping there or sleeping in cars . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: chance of a light snow flurry ahead
text: it will be cloudy this morning with patchy drizzle and mist .
it 'll become mainly dry this afternoon with some brighter intervals , but will feel increasingly cold in brisk easterly winds with a few light snow flurries .
maximum temperature 4c ( 39f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from northamptonshire
text: good morning and welcome back to the live page for northamptonshire where we 'll bring you updates of the latest news , weather , travel and sport until 18:00 .
this morning we 'll be looking at the homeless situation in rushden where is being reported that people are having to sleep in a shed and in cars on the site of a night shelter .
but first , a full regional weather forecast is coming up .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates for northamptonshire have finished .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 , but until then you can catch up on some of today 's stories :
see you tomorrow .

documents.title: weather : damp overnight and drizzle tomorrow
text: tonight will be cloudy with some patchy drizzle , particularly across eastern counties , but starting dry and clear in the west with mist patches forming .
becoming damp and drizzly across all parts later tonight , with lows of 3c ( 37f ) .
an overcast and increasingly cold day tomorrow will bring some showery outbreaks of drizzle , but some bright spells will develop .
highs of just 5c ( 41f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: uk places : what direction ?
text: did you know northampton is further south than bury st edmunds ?
as word of mouth looks at how where you are affects the way you think , we ask if you know where you are in comparison to the rest of the uk .
you can take on the quiz here .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: communities secretary rebukes mp bone over housing supply link with immigration
text: the government has vowed to build more affordable houses and help people buy and rent their homes after admitting the current market is `` broken '' .
however , wellingborough 's mp peter bone told the commons the housing shortage could be solved by reducing immigration .

conservative mr bone asked communities secretary sajid javid : `` would the secretary of state agree that the demand for housing would fall if we could reduce a third of a million people coming into this country each year ? ''
but mr javid suggested this would not make the difference `` he thinks it would '' .
he said two thirds of demand had `` nothing to do with immigration '' , but to do with people living longer .
he added that even if immigration fell to zero , there would still be a two million deficit of homes .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cut in the number of specialist roads police units
text: northamptonshire saw the biggest cut in dedicated roads police units in england and wales last year .
the reduction was 74 % in the county , followed by norfolk the second highest with 65 % .

the total number of specialist road officers across all 43 forces fell from 5,237 to 4,934 , according to data released by policing minister and great yarmouth mp , brandon lewis , in response to a parliamentary question .

jayne willetts , lead for roads policing for the police federation of england and wales , said : `` the thin blue line is now so thin on our roads system that we are almost to the point of being invisible . ''
however , mr lewis said some forces were unable to make a clear distinction between functions carried out by their officers , particularly for units providing both roads and armed policing .
he added that reclassification of roles can cause fluctuations in figures from year to year .
suzette davenport , national police chiefs ' council lead for roads policing , said : `` individual police forces decide how best to allocate resources and keep their communities safe .
`` some may choose to reduce the numbers of specialist traffic officers , but this does not mean that their roads are not adequately policed . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: speaker and buckingham mp defends trump opposition
text: commons speaker and buckingham mp john bercow has defended voicing his opposition to donald trump addressing parliament .
his comments , including accusing the us president of `` racism and sexism '' , had been made `` honestly and honourably '' and were within his remit , he told mps .
several conservatives have criticised the speaker , one saying his career could be in `` jeopardy '' and another that he had damaged the national interest .
downing street called his comments `` a matter for parliament '' .
the us president has accepted an invitation from the queen for a state visit to the uk , which can include an address to both houses of parliament , later this year .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: silverstone owners 'pausing for thought ' on sale
text: i 've also been finding out the latest on any potential sale of silverstone .
stuart pringle told me : `` we 've had some good trading results in the past few months , so pressure is slightly off us .
`` there are issues longer term that need addressing .
we 've had time to pause for thought .
things have changed with the new f1 owners coming in .
`` if we do n't have to sell then we wo n't , '' he added .

he said the part heritage lottery fund funded motorsport museum would bring a `` new younger audience '' to the circuit along with the world rallycross championships , which will come to the northamptonshire venue from 2018 .
i asked mr pringle whether all that means silverstone 's owners , the british racing drivers ' club , would not sell the circuit at the moment .
he replied : `` never say never . ''
author: Jonathan Park
BBC Look East sport

documents.title: strippers sentenced for rugby star threat
text: strippers sentenced for rugby star threat

documents.title: british grand prix at silverstone for next three years , with discussions '2020 onwards '
text: silverstone 's sporting director , stuart pringle , has told me there is `` certainly no question mark '' about the formula 1 british grand prix for the next three years .
he said any further discussion would be `` all about 2020 onwards '' .
the circuit 's presence on the calendar has been under threat because of the `` potentially ruinous risk '' of staging the loss-making race .
however , new formula 1 boss chase carey says there will be a british grand prix and mr pringle said he `` hopes to meet and have discussions '' with formula 1 's new owners , liberty media .
mr pringle added : `` there 's no bigger fan of formula 1 racing than me and i 'll be pretty disappointed if it was n't here at silverstone . ''
author: Jonathan Park
BBC Look East sport

documents.title: danny cipriani : northampton woman sentenced after blackmail attempt on rugby player
text: a dancer from northampton has avoided jail for blackmailing england and wasps fly-half danny cipriani for thousands of pounds after she aborted his child .

lisa murphy , 39 , from wootton , and her colleague violet smith , 29 , of slough , berkshire , were handed a 22-month sentence , suspended for two years , at kingston crown court in south-west london .
the pair admitted blackmailing cipriani , 29 , between september and october 2015 , during a hearing at the same court on monday .
the court heard ms murphy aborted mr cipriani 's baby in the summer of 2015 after a casual relationship with the rugby star .
it was said when she ran into health and financial difficulties in the months following , she asked the wasps ' player for more money .
when mr cipriani offered but failed to provide support , she enlisted the help of ms smith - with the pair threatening to go the papers with the story , the court was told .
judge peter lodder described it as an `` unusual case '' and said both defendants had suffered and lost their jobs as a result .
`` it is an understatement to say that nobody has come out of this episode well , '' he said .

documents.title: local paper round-up : call for hospital volunteers , marathon double and stanwick 's baker boy
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northamptonshire formula 1 teams to reveal 2017 cars in two weeks ' time
text: formula 1 teams have started their build-up to the 2017 season before the first race in australia on 26 march .
the teams kick-off pre-season at barcelona in spain on 27 february before returning for a second session in march .
silverstone-based force india ( will launch their car at their home circuit on 22 february , with drivers sergio perez and esteban ocon .
brackley-based mercedes will also be heading to silverstone , with drivers lewis hamilton and valtteri bottas launching their 2017 car the day after , on 23 february .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : cloudy start , but brighter spells developing
text: brighter spells will continue to develop across northamptonshire this afternoon .
it will be mostly dry too , though some may see an occasional shower towards the end of the day , with a high of 8c ( 46f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: edinburgh wants new cobblers mentality
text: edinburgh wants new cobblers mentality

documents.title: edinburgh takes 'positives ' from defeat , despite last-minute penalty miss
text: justin edinburgh also told me his side were still `` disappointed '' when they returned to training yesterday , after a 2-1 defeat at walsall .
northampton town captain marc richard missed a last-minute penalty , which would have given the cobblers a well-earned point .
edinburgh told me he 's `` quickly got morale up '' and `` took a lot of positives '' from the game .
but he emphasised they `` must be taking points from those kind of games '' and that northampton town `` need to stop being the team that 's unlucky to lose '' .
edinburgh , who has been in charge for almost a month now , said this change in attitude has to `` come from within '' the players , and they are working on `` getting the mindset right '' .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: justin edinburgh hopes for improved fitness of northampton town squad
text: i 've seen northampton town manager justin edinburgh this morning and he 's given me some updates on injuries .
he said defender zander diamond would train on thursday and be available for saturday 's game against chesterfield at sixfields , after coming off injured against walsall .
gaby zakuani is also back training after returning from the african cup of nations , but edinburgh said saturday `` may be too soon '' for him to play .
edinburgh told me they were `` mindful when we get [ players ] back fit we keep them fit '' .
he felt not enough of the squad was match fit and said new fitness coach pablo garcia had been brought in because he `` fits the remit '' of improved fitness .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: improvements at kettering general to prevent and treat bowel cancer
text: dr andrew dixon , from kettering general hospital , said the site already has a `` very large endoscopy unit '' , but the expansion will `` improve the ability for bowel screening '' to aid the prevention of bowel cancer .
he also said the £ 2.6m investment would help `` those do have symptoms who require procedures '' .
tina brooks , endoscopy services manager , said staff `` are well geared to help '' the extra 100 people per week they are expecting to see when the works are complete .
the £ 2.6m investment has come from the kettering general hospital nhs foundation trust .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: extra £ 2.6m being spent on cancer screening at hospital
text: improvements at kettering general hospital mean 100 extra people every week will be screened for bowel cancer .
work has already started on £ 2.6m of new facilities at the endoscopy unit , which serves people across the county .
doctors say for every 300 people screened , two are prevented from getting bowel cancer and one life is saved .
the money is being used to create a fifth endoscopy suite , to redesign the unit , put in some private rooms , and build a new decontamination unit to sterilise the equipment .
it 's hoped the improvements will be completed by september .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: on this day : george best scores six against the cobblers
text: it is northampton town 's most famous match - and they lost it 8-2 .
but on 7 february 1970 , manchester united came to the county ground , the cobblers ' then home , in the fa cup .
in the team that day , returning from a six-week suspension , was george best .
he went on to score six goals , with northampton town defender ray fairfax , who was marking george best , admitting : `` the closest i got to him was when we shook hands at the end of the game . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: councillors to discuss plans for new mk dons training ground
text: councillors in milton keynes will tonight discuss mk dons ' plans for a new training ground at newport pagnell .
the site at tickford fields is next to the a509 , between newport pagnell and sherington .
the dons have already put forward plans for a training ground at cosgrove in northamptonshire , but it 's thought the club would prefer a site in milton keynes .
it 's not yet known what would happen to the cosgrove plans if the newport pagnell training ground is given the green light .
councillors are being recommended to sell the land to the football club .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: police launch internet safety programme
text: following on from the sentencing of scott ayres yesterday , today it 's safer internet day .
northamptonshire police is launching an internet safety programme aimed at preventing the online grooming of teenagers .
det insp andy rogers said the force has ongoing investigations over the use of `` fake profiles '' , where adults pose as teenage girls on social media in order to groom children .
he said `` open conversations '' are needed with children about internet safety , but also things such as `` body safety '' and `` sexting '' - the sending of explicit images via phones .
he added there needed to be `` education and empowerment '' of young people .
happy # saferinternetday !
'be the change - unite for a better internet ' !
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: paedophile with 1,500 images of abused children 'worst ' offender
text: the head of the paedophile online investigation team at northamptonshire police says a man jailed yesterday after officers found more than 1,500 images and videos of children being abused was `` the worst case the team have come across '' .
scott ayres , 36 , of top fair furlong , milton keynes , was jailed for nearly eight years at northampton crown court after pleading guilty to 11 charges .
he was investigated by the force after being found to have connections to other known paedophiles .
det insp andy rogers said there had been an `` alarming increase '' in the number of offences recorded by police in the past few years .
since 2014 northamptonshire police has seen a 333 % increase in online child sex offences and has grown the investigations team as a result .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wrap up - a cold and damp day in store
text: a grey and damp start to the day , feeling chilly under the cloud .
the rain could stay for much of the day , gradually working eastwards .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning .
we are back again with live updates for northamptonshire .
today we 'll be looking at the improvements at the endoscopy unit at kettering general hospital and investigating the causes of homelessness in the county .
but first up the weather .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
any breaking news will appear here overnight and we 'll back tomorrow from 08:00 .
here are just a few of the things we 've covered today :
see you tomorrow .

documents.title: volunteer-run day centre turns profit
text: volunteer-run day centre turns profit

documents.title: a cloudy and wet night
text: tonight will be cloudy with outbreaks of rain spreading east , some of this will be on the heavy side .
we could see some low cloud and fog forming in places .
most parts should stay frost-free , with temperatures no lower than 3c ( 37f ) .
the east of the region is expected to remain cloudy tomorrow , with outbreaks of rain and drizzle .
in the west there 's a greater chance of it becoming drier , with a few showers and some brightness and sunshine .
temperatures climbing to 8c ( 46f ) .
weather has more details for where you live .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: glamis hall : volunteers make wellingborough day care centre profitable
text: volunteers who took over the running of a northamptonshire day care centre after a council called the site `` no longer fit for purpose '' say they are running at a profit two years on .
glamis hall was closed in 2014 following cuts to wellingborough borough council 's social care budget .
freehold of the building , on goldsmith road , was granted to volunteers a year later after they presented a business plan to run it as a community amenity .
they also managed to obtain a grant for refurbishment .
now the centre provides hot food and entertainment to more than 180 elderly people a week .
the volunteer group , glamis hall for all , says all the profits raised are being put straight back into the centre .
you can see more on glamis hall on inside out on bbc one tonight .
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: corby crisp manufacturer bags two companies
text: the potato crisp manufacturer tayto , which employs more than 500 people in corby , has bought another snack food company and partly acquired another .
the tayto group has now bought london-based firm tavern snacks , which sells nuts , eggs and cockles among its products , and has acquired 75 % of devon-based portlebay popcorn .
the company told me the diversification of the business helps secure the future of the golden wonder factory on corby 's earlstrees industrial estate - another brand owned by tayto .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: local paper round-up : third without a flu jab and major crash on a45
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: alastair cook : 'one of england 's finest captains ' - ben duckett
text: alastair cook has resigned as england test captain after a record 59 matches in charge .
northamptonshire 's ben duckett - who opened the batting with cook in the recent tour of bangladesh - took to twitter to pay tribute
it 's a pleasure to be able to say i 've opened the batting with him !
one of englands finest captains # captaincook
@ twitterid real opportunity for cook to mentor new openers and he play at 3 or 4 .
loads of runs to come !
he was destined to succeed with that jawline ! !
he must have stepped down as england captain but he will always be the captain of my heart # loveyoucooky

documents.title: man jailed for having 1,500 indecent images of children
text: a man caught with more than 1,500 images and videos of children being abused has been jailed for seven years and eight months at northampton crown court .
scott ayres , 36 , of top fair furlong , milton keynes , was investigated by northamptonshire police after being found to have connections to other known paedophiles .

ayres pleaded guilty to 11 charges including making indecent images , possession of extreme images , possession of prohibited images , and five counts of attempting to arrange or facilitate a child sex offence .
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : dry today , but turning unsettled later
text: the rest of this afternoon will be dry with sunny spells before cloud starts to increase later , though it will feel rather chilly with a high of 6c ( 43f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: rushden to host afc rushden and diamonds from next season
text: afc rushden and diamonds have revealed they will playing at the home of rushden and higham fc , hayden road , from next season .
the club are having to leave their current home of the dog and duck in wellingborough after the landlord decided both diamonds and wellingborough town had to vacate .
diamonds put three ground options to the club 's membership - hayden road , kempston rovers and northampton sileby rangers - with the rushden venue receiving 94 % of the vote .
the club say they need to work on the ground before it meets regulations and will play at another venue for a short period at the start of next season until it is ready .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: northampton and kettering in top 10 most occupied hospitals in england this winter
text: northamptonshire 's hospitals have had some of the highest bed-occupancy rates in the country this winter , according to data released by the nhs .
northampton general has peaked at 99.48 % , while kettering general hit 98.93 %
both are well above the recommended safe level of 85 % .
the figures for december and january showed northampton had the sixth highest proportion of beds occupied each day in england and kettering the tenth .
unless the hospitals have spare beds they are unable to admit new patients .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: in frosty sunrise across northamptonshire
text: our bbc weather watchers captured this morning 's chilly , but beautiful sunrise across the county
sign up to become a weather watcher here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: five men charged after 'industrial scale ' cannabis farm found near rugby
text: five men have been charged with drug and fraud offences after an industrial scale '' cannabis farm was discovered near rugby .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: york draw brackley town in fa trophy quarter finals
text: is this a good draw for minstermen fans ?
breaking : # ycfc drawn at home to @ twitterid in @ twitterid trophy quarter-finals .
tie to be played on sat 25 feb. full commentary @ twitterid
author: Sharon Shortle

documents.title: northampton saints sign australian centre horne
text: meanwhile , we 've heard that australian outside centre rob horne will joining northampton saints next season .
the 27-year-old , who has won 33 international caps , joins from new south wales waratahs .
horne vice-captained the wallabies last year and saints director of rugby , jim mallinder , described him as a `` real asset '' .
he is the saints ' first signing for the 2017-18 season .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: six nations : wales ' north injured but still manged to run 60 metres to score
text: it 's fair to say northampton wing george north had an eventful sunday .
north played on after taking an early blow to the thigh in wales ' 33-7 win over italy in rome .
after the game it emerged the 24-year-old had a haematoma - a swelling of clotted blood - on his thigh .
however , the wing 's 60-metre try in the 77th minute was wales ' highlight .
he beat three plays despite being in obvious discomfort
wales ' coach rob howley said he 's `` hopeful '' north will be available for selection to face england in cardiff on saturday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: northampton sign australia 's horne
text: northampton sign australia 's horne

documents.title: homelessness on the rise
text: as a new emergency night shelter opens in northampton today , i 've been looking at the numbers behind a rise in homelessness in the county .
in 2016 , 929 people were accepted as homeless by northamptonshire 's councils .
that 's a rise of 56 % in the last three years .
many of those 929 people will be in temporary accommodation or on the sofas of friends or family members , rather than sleeping rough .
you can see more about how councils are dealing with homelessness by watching yesterday 's sunday politics east on bbc iplayer .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: night shelter to open
text: a new emergency night shelter for homeless men will open in northampton tonight .
the old british rail social club is being used to cater for up to 20 people a night .
northampton borough council is employing two staff members , but the bulk of the work will be done by more than 50 volunteers .
stephen hibbert , cabinet member for housing , says he has been `` impressed by the skills and experience '' of the volunteers who have come forward .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: travel : harborough road closed
text: in market harborough , the b6047 harborough road is closed between gallow fields road and the a6
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northampton saints turn attention to premiership after cup elimination
text: northampton saints ' full-back ben foden says everyone 's attention is now centred on the premiership - with a trip to bath on friday night .
despite a 50-10 win over scarlets on friday night - saracens beat leicester with a bonus-point 29-20 win yesterday , meaning they 've been knocked out of the anglo welsh cup .
foden says with the saints in sixth and bath in fourth , northampton need to win to have a chance of a top four finish for the end of season premiership play-offs .
he admitted both sides `` have lost big players '' to the six nations , but said `` it 'll be tough '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: monday 's weather : cloudy at first , brighter later
text: it 's a rather grey start for many of us this morning , although there are clearer skies out towards the west where we will have a bit of sunshine .
there 's a bit of mist and fog out there as well - that will gradually lift as the cloud moves away .
we may get a spot of rain out towards the east coast but for most places there 'll be sunshine throughout the afternoon and a top temperature of 7c ( 45f ) .
get my full bbc east regional forecast here :
for more detail where you are , visit bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: good morning
text: hello .
welcome to another week of live updates for northamptonshire .
this morning we 'll be taking a look at :
but first up , the chilly weather forecast .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: former soldier plans solo ocean row
text: former soldier plans solo ocean row

documents.title: walsall 2-1 northampton town
text: walsall 2-1 northampton town

documents.title: northampton saints 50-10 scarlets
text: northampton saints 50-10 scarlets
